{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3169943,"name":"mtomczak","username":"mtomczak","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mtomczak/{size}/8431_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-22T01:00:00.341Z","cooked":"

Ran into a surprising issue with our drive configuration tonight.

We’ve been experimenting with adding a second Logitech Attack 3 controller to our drivers station (running off a Legion Y540-15IRH laptop). When we plug in more than one Attack 3 joystick, the drivers station only recognizes one of them. This isn’t a behavior we’re seeing with our other laptop (although changing out laptops for the drivers station this late in the game is risky; the other one has a propensity to bluescreen periodically).

We don’t see the same issue if we plug in an XBox controller and ATK-3 at the same time.

Has anyone ever encountered this “Only one joystick of a kind is recognized at a time” issue?
